title: Data losses on mobile when offline
body: After a period of inactivity, messages are not always retrieved.

Investigating a message that has been lost:

```

INFO [11-22|22:57:10.323|github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/messenger.go:3676]                          processing message                       site=RetrieveAll hash=0x30094f559cb45bf123f43b45304a456e463cab3c3fd011de8d67150fd4c8c622 message-id=0x0dc45dd3e5e96b69c842e7e9ff05eb075885544f9f377afe0c799fe0bbd1bd92
```

This message was received on my desktop machine, but not on mobile, and was sent in a community. Mobile most likely was not running (can't be 100% sure).

The message made it to the fleet:
```
https://kibana.infra.status.im/app/discover#/?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-7d%2Fd,to:now))&_a=(columns:!(),filters:!(),index:ffcc22b0-0116-11ed-9719-cdd3b483481c,interval:auto,query:(language:kuery,query:%220x30094f559cb45bf123f43b45304a456e463cab3c3fd011de8d67150fd4c8c622%22),sort:!(!('@timestamp',desc)))
```

at least it looks like. I will start looking into whether they made it to the store nodes.

```
kv_raw:topics="waku filter" tid=1 file=protocol.nim:212 pubsubTopic=/waku/2/default-waku/proto contentTopic=/waku/1/0x1260a8e1/rfc26 hash=0x30094f559cb45bf123f43b45304a456e463cab3c3fd011de8d67150fd4c8c622
```
This is the content topic of the envelope,

https://github.com/waku-org/test-waku-query/blob/3ef445617478005b47ccdd03486a078271e66f17/main_test.go#L24-L29  I will use this script to check the existence of the envelope

```

2023-11-23T15:24:06.685Z        INFO    gowaku.TEST     test-waku-query/utils_test.go:80        62 messages found in 16Uiu2HAmSve7tR5YZugpskMv2dmJAsMUKmfWYEKRXNUxRaTCnsXV (Used cursor 1 times)


```

We can see there's some difference on what's stored on each store node, I will check for the specific envelope hash.

Ok, looks like on mobile I am using relay, although I thought it would use light node, so oddly enough it might not be filterpush related. but there's a bug where the synced version is not honouring device specific settings (if I sync desktop with mobile, the mobile version should have lightnode enabled regardless of what desktop has enabled).
